alert_name: PSExec Lateral Movement to File Server
description: Suspicious PSExec-based lateral movement detected from compromised workstation HR-WKS-089 (10.50.15.142) to production file server FS-PROD-01 (10.50.20.10) 75 minutes after credential dumping. The attacker used stolen Domain Admin credentials (IT-Admin@victimcorp.local) to remotely execute malicious payload via PsExec.exe service. Command: 'psexec.exe \\FS-PROD-01 -accepteula -s -d C:\Windows\Temp\stage2.exe'. The remote service PSEXESVC was installed on FS-PROD-01 and executed payload with SYSTEM privileges. Network traffic shows SMB connections on port 445 and named pipe \pipe\PSEXESVC communication. The stage2.exe payload (SHA256: 7d68da8aa78929bb467682ddb080e750ed07cd21b1ee7a9f38cf2810eeb9cb95) is confirmed Medusa ransomware second-stage loader. This lateral movement technique leveraged legitimate Windows Admin Shares (C$, ADMIN$) to propagate the attack from the initial compromised workstation to critical file server infrastructure, enabling access to 15TB of sensitive corporate data.
policy_description: PSExec lateral movement - Medusa ransomware propagation to file server
policy_recommendation: Isolate FS-PROD-01 immediately, kill PSEXESVC service, remove stage2.exe payload, disable IT-Admin account and force password reset, block SMB traffic from HR-WKS-089, enable Admin Share restrictions, audit all systems for PSEXESVC service, implement network segmentation
mitre_att&ck_technique: T1021.002 - Remote Services: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
